frame.name: Typicality
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> is generally, or with regard to a particular <fen>Feature</fen>, representative of the <fen>Comparison_set</fen> of which it is a member.
<ex>The Elan truly is an <t>unusual</t> <fex name="ent">car</fex>; the first and only Lotus with a front engined/front wheel drive layout, and the first new Lotus to be introduced since 1975.</ex>
<ex> I need a plain, <t>vanilla</t> <fex name="ent">example</fex> that doesn't use PRINT! </ex>
<ex>How smart is the <t>average</t> <fex name="ent">drug user/experimenter</fex>? </ex>
<ex>It's not <t>unusual</t> <fex name="Entity">to be loved by anyone</fex>, It's not unusual to have fun with anyone,</ex>
<ex>Is <fex name="Feature">lying</fex> <t>normal</t> <fex name="com">for a child this age</fex>, and how can I best handle this situation?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Entity</fen> varies from other members of the <fen>Comparison_set</fen>.
<ex>That is a <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>unusual</t> bear.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The concrete or abstract thing which is evaluated with regard to whether it exhibits the essential characteristics of a Comparison_set.
<ex> However I have always loved having an <t>unusual</t> <fex name="ent">name</fex> and I think it's a beautiful name. .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Comparison_set
FE.definition:
<def-root>The set of indviduals, which are of similar kind to the <fen>Entity</fen>, and to which the <fen>Entity</fen> is compared.
<ex>It's not <t>unusual</t> <fex name="com">for interviewers</fex> to look beyond a resume and face-to-face meeting to find the unspoken clues about your personality.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Feature
FE.definition:
<def-root>A property of the <fen>Entity</fen> wherein it differs or is similar to members of a <fen>Comparison_set</fen>.
<ex>David Hasselhoff's daughters are <t>normal</t> <fex name="fea">in every way</fex>. </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: normal.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: conforming to a standard; usual, typical, or expected.

lexUnit.name: ordinary.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: with no distinctive features; normal or usual

lexUnit.name: average.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: a usual or ordinary amount, level, or rate.

lexUnit.name: vanilla.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having no special or extra features.
